about.name: Roy Chen
about.education: Asia Eastern University of Science and Technology

introduction.section1: I am a frontend engineer specializing in React, with years of development experience. I have participated in and built multiple projects, gaining expertise in the micro-frontend architecture. I prioritize code maintainability and am committed to writing high-quality, scalable frontend applications.

pentium-network.instruction:
● Use Webpack5 and Module Federation for the main and micro-app projects.
● Use GitHub Actions for CI code inspections.
● Replace Jest with Vitest to speed up tests.
● Write unit and component tests with React Testing Library.
● Implement multilingual support with i18next.
● Replace Webpack with Rsbuild for faster bundling and use Module Federation 2.0.

Projects:

● Develop "<pentium-agent-link>Pentium Agent</pentium-agent-link>":
   ○ Build a desktop app using Electron.
   ○ Create the UI with Vite, React, and Typescript.
   ○ Build the API Server with tRPC and SQLite.
   ○ Develop basic AI chat and MCP Server configuration.

● Develop "<rapd-link>RAPD</rapd-link>":
   ○ Build a micro frontend architecture with Webpack5 and Module Federation.
   ○ Use Auth0 for authentication.
   ○ Develop related micro-apps.

● Develop the Component Library:
   ○ Build shared components with Antd for reusability across products.
   ○ Bundle with Rollup and publish to a private npm server.
   ○ Document components with Storybook.
   ○ Design a Theme & i18n system.
   ○ Implement a CSS cache method.
   ○ Develop components: Upload, UploadModal, SelectionArea, and SearchFilter.

● Design and develop the Micro Frontends Framework:
   ○ Build a framework package to let developers focus on product features.
   ○ Use MobX for state management between micro-apps.
   ○ Design interfaces connecting the main app and micro-apps.

● Develop the "create micro app" CLI:
   ○ Build a CLI in Typescript for scaffolding micro frontend projects.

● Maintain "<mrvn-link>MRVN</mrvn-link>":
   ○ Use Webpack5 and Module Federation to integrate React micro frontends into a Vue project.
   ○ Build related micro-apps.

● Maintain "<mavis-link>MAVIS</mavis-link>".

● Maintain "<gateone-link>GateOne</gateone-link>":
   ○ Fix bugs in the web terminal emulator related to cursor and pointer operations.

bibian.instruction:
● Use next.js & Redux to build front-end system
● Write unit tests with Jest & component tests with React Testing Library
● Use Husky with Eslint, Prettier & Jest to practice git commit automated testing and correction
● Use swiper to achieve carousel effect
● According to the Figma provided by the design, use styled-components to make the page
● Planning api with back-end developer

Project:

● Develop "Drug Bibian":
　○ Project Construction
　○ Mainly responsible for the home page and product page
　○ Write the product data structure that "BBC bar" can parse, which can reduce the cost of parsing and development, and can be tested

● Maintain "<bbcheckout-link>Cross-border Purchase Service</bbcheckout-link>":
　○ Parse the HTML document of the partner e-commerce, and convert the product page into a data that can be used by the "BBC bar"
　○ Refactoring projects using Web Components
　　■ Reduce development costs by 90%, and more as demand increases
　　■ Reduce initial page load speed

● Maintain "Product Inclusion Tool - Chrome Extension":
　○ Optimize webpack to increase building speed
　○ Repurchase and optimization projects
　　■ Split component, page
　　■ Integration api, "chrome.runtime.sendMessage"
　　■ Form validation into "custom hook"
　　■ Fix bugs

● Refactored "<bbcstore-link>Buy on Demand</bbcstore-link>" channel (refactored version is not online):
　○ Divide component blocks, so that the background can be set for different blocks, providing customized web page layout
　○ Can reduce development costs by 90%, and can continue to create new blocks with designers
　○ Use "React Hook Form" for form validation and provide background form filling function
　○ For the purpose of reduce the first load of the page, practice infinite scrolling of the page
　○ The background setting interface provides the component dragging function to adjust the order of products
　○ UI/UX optimization

bankpro.instruction:
● Development of <sunnybank-link>sunnybank Enterprise Internet Bank</sunnybank-link>:
　○ Mainly responsible for functions: account transaction inquiry, user management settings and transfer transaction functions in Taiwan and foreign currencies
　○ Use "formik" for form validation, providing form filling functions
　○ Connect the card reader to handle authentication and set the chip card password
　○ ".csv" and ".txt" file download, web friendly printing
　○ Use "react-intl" to implement multiple languages
　○ Analysis and planning of redux and saga code splitting can reduce the first code load, which is estimated to be reduced by more than 50%
　○ The code provided by the outsourcers is integrated into the React project, and UI/UX optimization if necessary
